00109 typedef struct _DDCOLORKEY
00110 {
00111     DWORD       dwColorSpaceLowValue;   // low boundary of color space that is to 
00112                                         // be treated as Color Key, inclusive
00113     DWORD       dwColorSpaceHighValue;  // high boundary of color space that is 
00114                                         // to be treated as Color Key, inclusive
00115 } DDCOLORKEY;

00119 /*
00120  * DDBLTFX
00121  * Used to pass override information to the DIRECTDRAWSURFACE callback Blt.
00122  */
00123 typedef struct _DDBLTFX
00124 {
00125     DWORD       dwSize;                         // size of structure
00126     DWORD       dwDDFX;                         // FX operations
00127     DWORD       dwROP;                          // Win32 raster operations
00128     DWORD       dwDDROP;                        // Raster operations new for DirectDraw
00129     DWORD       dwRotationAngle;                // Rotation angle for blt
00130     DWORD       dwZBufferOpCode;                // ZBuffer compares
00131     DWORD       dwZBufferLow;                   // Low limit of Z buffer
00132     DWORD       dwZBufferHigh;                  // High limit of Z buffer
00133     DWORD       dwZBufferBaseDest;              // Destination base value
00134     DWORD       dwZDestConstBitDepth;           // Bit depth used to specify Z constant for destination
00135     union
00136     {
00137         DWORD   dwZDestConst;                   // Constant to use as Z buffer for dest
00138         LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE lpDDSZBufferDest;   // Surface to use as Z buffer for dest
00139     };
00140     DWORD       dwZSrcConstBitDepth;            // Bit depth used to specify Z constant for source
00141     union
00142     {
00143         DWORD   dwZSrcConst;                    // Constant to use as Z buffer for src
00144         LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE lpDDSZBufferSrc;    // Surface to use as Z buffer for src
00145     };
00146     DWORD       dwAlphaEdgeBlendBitDepth;       // Bit depth used to specify constant for alpha edge blend
00147     DWORD       dwAlphaEdgeBlend;               // Alpha for edge blending
00148     DWORD       dwReserved;
00149     DWORD       dwAlphaDestConstBitDepth;       // Bit depth used to specify alpha constant for destination
00150     union
00151     {
00152         DWORD   dwAlphaDestConst;               // Constant to use as Alpha Channel
00153         LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE lpDDSAlphaDest;     // Surface to use as Alpha Channel
00154     };
00155     DWORD       dwAlphaSrcConstBitDepth;        // Bit depth used to specify alpha constant for source
00156     union
00157     {
00158         DWORD   dwAlphaSrcConst;                // Constant to use as Alpha Channel
00159         LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE lpDDSAlphaSrc;      // Surface to use as Alpha Channel
00160     };
00161     union
00162     {
00163         DWORD   dwFillColor;                    // color in RGB or Palettized
00164         DWORD   dwFillDepth;                    // depth value for z-buffer
00165         LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE lpDDSPattern;       // Surface to use as pattern
00166     };
00167     DDCOLORKEY  ddckDestColorkey;               // DestColorkey override
00168     DDCOLORKEY  ddckSrcColorkey;                // SrcColorkey override
00169 } DDBLTFX;
00170 
00171 typedef DDBLTFX FAR* LPDDBLTFX;
00172

00184 /*
00185  * DDCAPS
00186  */
00187 #define DD_ROP_SPACE            (256/32)        // space required to store ROP array
00188 
00189 typedef struct _DDCAPS
00190 {
00191     DWORD       dwSize;                 // size of the DDDRIVERCAPS structure
00192     DWORD       dwCaps;                 // driver specific capabilities
00193     DWORD       dwCaps2;                // more driver specific capabilites
00194     DWORD       dwCKeyCaps;             // color key capabilities of the surface
00195     DWORD       dwFXCaps;               // driver specific stretching and effects capabilites
00196     DWORD       dwFXAlphaCaps;          // alpha driver specific capabilities
00197     DWORD       dwPalCaps;              // palette capabilities
00198     DWORD       dwSVCaps;               // stereo vision capabilities
00199     DWORD       dwAlphaBltConstBitDepths;       // DDBD_2,4,8
00200     DWORD       dwAlphaBltPixelBitDepths;       // DDBD_1,2,4,8
00201     DWORD       dwAlphaBltSurfaceBitDepths;     // DDBD_1,2,4,8
00202     DWORD       dwAlphaOverlayConstBitDepths;   // DDBD_2,4,8
00203     DWORD       dwAlphaOverlayPixelBitDepths;   // DDBD_1,2,4,8
00204     DWORD       dwAlphaOverlaySurfaceBitDepths; // DDBD_1,2,4,8
00205     DWORD       dwZBufferBitDepths;             // DDBD_8,16,24,32
00206     DWORD       dwVidMemTotal;          // total amount of video memory
00207     DWORD       dwVidMemFree;           // amount of free video memory
00208     DWORD       dwMaxVisibleOverlays;   // maximum number of visible overlays
00209     DWORD       dwCurrVisibleOverlays;  // current number of visible overlays
00210     DWORD       dwNumFourCCCodes;       // number of four cc codes
00211     DWORD       dwAlignBoundarySrc;     // source rectangle alignment
00212     DWORD       dwAlignSizeSrc;         // source rectangle byte size
00213     DWORD       dwAlignBoundaryDest;    // dest rectangle alignment
00214     DWORD       dwAlignSizeDest;        // dest rectangle byte size
00215     DWORD       dwAlignStrideAlign;     // stride alignment
00216     DWORD       dwRops[DD_ROP_SPACE];   // ROPS supported
00217     DDSCAPS     ddsCaps;                // DDSCAPS structure has all the general capabilities
00218     DWORD       dwMinOverlayStretch;    // minimum overlay stretch factor multiplied by 1000, eg 1000 == 1.0, 1300 == 1.3
00219     DWORD       dwMaxOverlayStretch;    // maximum overlay stretch factor multiplied by 1000, eg 1000 == 1.0, 1300 == 1.3
00220     DWORD       dwMinLiveVideoStretch;  // minimum live video stretch factor multiplied by 1000, eg 1000 == 1.0, 1300 == 1.3
00221     DWORD       dwMaxLiveVideoStretch;  // maximum live video stretch factor multiplied by 1000, eg 1000 == 1.0, 1300 == 1.3
00222     DWORD       dwMinHwCodecStretch;    // minimum hardware codec stretch factor multiplied by 1000, eg 1000 == 1.0, 1300 == 1.3
00223     DWORD       dwMaxHwCodecStretch;    // maximum hardware codec stretch factor multiplied by 1000, eg 1000 == 1.0, 1300 == 1.3
00224     DWORD       dwReserved1;            // reserved
00225     DWORD       dwReserved2;            // reserved
00226     DWORD       dwReserved3;            // reserved
00227     DWORD       dwSVBCaps;              // driver specific capabilities for System->Vmem blts
00228     DWORD       dwSVBCKeyCaps;          // driver color key capabilities for System->Vmem blts
00229     DWORD       dwSVBFXCaps;            // driver FX capabilities for System->Vmem blts
00230     DWORD       dwSVBRops[DD_ROP_SPACE];// ROPS supported for System->Vmem blts
00231     DWORD       dwVSBCaps;              // driver specific capabilities for Vmem->System blts
00232     DWORD       dwVSBCKeyCaps;          // driver color key capabilities for Vmem->System blts
00233     DWORD       dwVSBFXCaps;            // driver FX capabilities for Vmem->System blts
00234     DWORD       dwVSBRops[DD_ROP_SPACE];// ROPS supported for Vmem->System blts
00235     DWORD       dwSSBCaps;              // driver specific capabilities for System->System blts
00236     DWORD       dwSSBCKeyCaps;          // driver color key capabilities for System->System blts
00237     DWORD       dwSSBFXCaps;            // driver FX capabilities for System->System blts
00238     DWORD       dwSSBRops[DD_ROP_SPACE];// ROPS supported for System->System blts
00239     DWORD       dwReserved4;            // reserved
00240     DWORD       dwReserved5;            // reserved
00241     DWORD       dwReserved6;            // reserved
00242 } DDCAPS;
00243 
00244 typedef DDCAPS FAR* LPDDCAPS;

00248 /*
00249  * DDPIXELFORMAT
00250  */
00251 typedef struct _DDPIXELFORMAT
00252 {
00253     DWORD       dwSize;                 // size of structure
00254     DWORD       dwFlags;                // pixel format flags
00255     DWORD       dwFourCC;               // (FOURCC code)
00256     union
00257     {
00258         DWORD   dwRGBBitCount;          // how many bits per pixel
00259         DWORD   dwYUVBitCount;          // how many bits per pixel
00260         DWORD   dwZBufferBitDepth;      // how many bits for z buffers
00261         DWORD   dwAlphaBitDepth;        // how many bits for alpha channels
00262     };
00263     union
00264     {
00265         DWORD   dwRBitMask;             // mask for red bit
00266         DWORD   dwYBitMask;             // mask for Y bits
00267     };
00268     union
00269     {
00270         DWORD   dwGBitMask;             // mask for green bits
00271         DWORD   dwUBitMask;             // mask for U bits
00272     };
00273     union
00274     {
00275         DWORD   dwBBitMask;             // mask for blue bits
00276         DWORD   dwVBitMask;             // mask for V bits
00277     };
00278     union
00279     {
00280         DWORD   dwRGBAlphaBitMask;      // mask for alpha channel
00281         DWORD   dwYUVAlphaBitMask;      // mask for alpha channel
00282     };
00283 } DDPIXELFORMAT;
00284 
00285 typedef DDPIXELFORMAT FAR* LPDDPIXELFORMAT;
00286

00288  * DDOVERLAYFX
00289  */
00290 typedef struct _DDOVERLAYFX
00291 {
00292     DWORD       dwSize;                         // size of structure
00293     DWORD       dwAlphaEdgeBlendBitDepth;       // Bit depth used to specify constant for alpha edge blend
00294     DWORD       dwAlphaEdgeBlend;               // Constant to use as alpha for edge blend
00295     DWORD       dwReserved;
00296     DWORD       dwAlphaDestConstBitDepth;       // Bit depth used to specify alpha constant for destination
00297     union
00298     {
00299         DWORD   dwAlphaDestConst;               // Constant to use as alpha channel for dest
00300         LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE lpDDSAlphaDest;     // Surface to use as alpha channel for dest
00301     };
00302     DWORD       dwAlphaSrcConstBitDepth;        // Bit depth used to specify alpha constant for source
00303     union
00304     {
00305         DWORD   dwAlphaSrcConst;                // Constant to use as alpha channel for src
00306         LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE lpDDSAlphaSrc;      // Surface to use as alpha channel for src
00307     };
00308     DDCOLORKEY  dckDestColorkey;                // DestColorkey override
00309     DDCOLORKEY  dckSrcColorkey;                 // DestColorkey override
00310     DWORD       dwDDFX;                         // Overlay FX
00311     DWORD       dwFlags;                        // flags
00312 } DDOVERLAYFX;

00350 #if defined( _WIN32 ) && !defined( _NO_COM )
00351 #undef INTERFACE
00352 #define INTERFACE IDirectDraw
00353 DECLARE_INTERFACE_( IDirectDraw, IUnknown )
00354 {
00355     /*** IUnknown methods ***/
00356     STDMETHOD(QueryInterface) (THIS_ REFIID riid, LPVOID FAR * ppvObj) PURE;
00357     STDMETHOD_(ULONG,AddRef) (THIS)  PURE;
00358     STDMETHOD_(ULONG,Release) (THIS) PURE;
00359     /*** IDirectDraw methods ***/
00360     STDMETHOD(Compact)(THIS) PURE;
00361     STDMETHOD(CreateClipper)(THIS_ DWORD, LPDIRECTDRAWCLIPPER FAR*, IUnknown FAR * ) PURE;
00362     STDMETHOD(CreatePalette)(THIS_ DWORD, LPPALETTEENTRY, LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE FAR*, IUnknown FAR * ) PURE;
00363     STDMETHOD(CreateSurface)(THIS_  LPDDSURFACEDESC, LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE FAR *, IUnknown FAR *) PURE;
00364     STDMETHOD(DuplicateSurface)( THIS_ LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE, LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE FAR * ) PURE;
00365     STDMETHOD(EnumDisplayModes)( THIS_ DWORD, LPDDSURFACEDESC, LPVOID, LPDDENUMMODESCALLBACK ) PURE;
00366     STDMETHOD(EnumSurfaces)(THIS_ DWORD, LPDDSURFACEDESC, LPVOID,LPDDENUMSURFACESCALLBACK ) PURE;
00367     STDMETHOD(FlipToGDISurface)(THIS) PURE;
00368     STDMETHOD(GetCaps)( THIS_ LPDDCAPS, LPDDCAPS) PURE;
00369     STDMETHOD(GetDisplayMode)( THIS_ LPDDSURFACEDESC) PURE;
00370     STDMETHOD(GetFourCCCodes)(THIS_  LPDWORD, LPDWORD ) PURE;
00371     STDMETHOD(GetGDISurface)(THIS_ LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE FAR *) PURE;
00372     STDMETHOD(GetMonitorFrequency)(THIS_ LPDWORD) PURE;
00373     STDMETHOD(GetScanLine)(THIS_ LPDWORD) PURE;
00374     STDMETHOD(GetVerticalBlankStatus)(THIS_ LPBOOL ) PURE;
00375     STDMETHOD(Initialize)(THIS_ GUID FAR *) PURE;
00376     STDMETHOD(RestoreDisplayMode)(THIS) PURE;
00377     STDMETHOD(SetCooperativeLevel)(THIS_ HWND, DWORD) PURE;
00378     STDMETHOD(SetDisplayMode)(THIS_ DWORD, DWORD,DWORD) PURE;
00379     STDMETHOD(WaitForVerticalBlank)(THIS_ DWORD, HANDLE ) PURE;
00380 };

00721 
00722 /*
00723  * DDSURFACEDESC
00724  */
00725 typedef struct _DDSURFACEDESC
00726 {
00727     DWORD               dwSize;                 // size of the DDSURFACEDESC structure
00728     DWORD               dwFlags;                // determines what fields are valid
00729     DWORD               dwHeight;               // height of surface to be created
00730     DWORD               dwWidth;                // width of input surface
00731     LONG                lPitch;                 // distance to start of next line (return value only)
00732     DWORD               dwBackBufferCount;      // number of back buffers requested
00733     union
00734     {
00735         DWORD           dwMipMapCount;          // number of mip-map levels requested
00736         DWORD           dwZBufferBitDepth;      // depth of Z buffer requested
00737         DWORD           dwRefreshRate;          // refresh rate (used when display mode is described)
00738     };
00739     DWORD               dwAlphaBitDepth;        // depth of alpha buffer requested
00740     DWORD               dwReserved;             // reserved
00741     LPVOID              lpSurface;              // pointer to the associated surface memory
00742     DDCOLORKEY          ddckCKDestOverlay;      // color key for destination overlay use
00743     DDCOLORKEY          ddckCKDestBlt;          // color key for destination blt use
00744     DDCOLORKEY          ddckCKSrcOverlay;       // color key for source overlay use
00745     DDCOLORKEY          ddckCKSrcBlt;           // color key for source blt use
00746     DDPIXELFORMAT       ddpfPixelFormat;        // pixel format description of the surface
00747     DDSCAPS             ddsCaps;                // direct draw surface capabilities
00748 } DDSURFACEDESC;
00749 
00750 /*
00751  * ddsCaps field is valid.
00752  */
00753 #define DDSD_CAPS               0x00000001l     // default
00754 
00755 /*
00756  * dwHeight field is valid.
00757  */
00758 #define DDSD_HEIGHT             0x00000002l
00759 
00760 /*
00761  * dwWidth field is valid.
00762  */
00763 #define DDSD_WIDTH              0x00000004l
00764 
00765 /*
00766  * lPitch is valid.
00767  */
00768 #define DDSD_PITCH              0x00000008l
00769 
00770 /*
00771  * dwBackBufferCount is valid.
00772  */
00773 #define DDSD_BACKBUFFERCOUNT    0x00000020l
00774 
00775 /*
00776  * dwZBufferBitDepth is valid.
00777  */
00778 #define DDSD_ZBUFFERBITDEPTH    0x00000040l
00779 
00780 /*
00781  * dwAlphaBitDepth is valid.
00782  */
00783 #define DDSD_ALPHABITDEPTH      0x00000080l
00784 
00785 
00786 
00787 /*
00788  * ddpfPixelFormat is valid.
00789  */
00790 #define DDSD_PIXELFORMAT        0x00001000l
00791 
00792 /*
00793  * ddckCKDestOverlay is valid.
00794  */
00795 #define DDSD_CKDESTOVERLAY      0x00002000l
00796 
00797 /*
00798  * ddckCKDestBlt is valid.
00799  */
00800 #define DDSD_CKDESTBLT          0x00004000l
00801 
00802 /*
00803  * ddckCKSrcOverlay is valid.
00804  */
00805 #define DDSD_CKSRCOVERLAY       0x00008000l
00806 
00807 /*
00808  * ddckCKSrcBlt is valid.
00809  */
00810 #define DDSD_CKSRCBLT           0x00010000l
00811 
00812 /*
00813  * dwMipMapCount is valid.
00814  */
00815 #define DDSD_MIPMAPCOUNT        0x00020000l
00816 
00817  /*
00818   * dwRefreshRate is valid
00819   */
00820 #define DDSD_REFRESHRATE        0x00040000l
00821 
00822 
00823 /*
00824  * All input fields are valid. 
00825  */
00826 #define DDSD_ALL                0x0007f9eel
00827 
00828 
00829 /*============================================================================
00830  *
00831  * Direct Draw Capability Flags
00832  *
00833  * These flags are used to describe the capabilities of a given Surface.
00834  * All flags are bit flags. 
00835  *
00836  *==========================================================================*/
00837 
00838 /****************************************************************************
00839  *
00840  * DIRECTDRAWSURFACE CAPABILITY FLAGS
00841  *
00842  ****************************************************************************/
00843 /*
00844  * This bit currently has no meaning.
00845  */
00846 #define DDSCAPS_3D                              0x00000001l
00847 
00848 /*
00849  * Indicates that this surface contains alpha information.  The pixel
00850  * format must be interrogated to determine whether this surface
00851  * contains only alpha information or alpha information interlaced
00852  * with pixel color data (e.g. RGBA or YUVA).
00853  */
00854 #define DDSCAPS_ALPHA                           0x00000002l
00855 
00856 /*
00857  * Indicates that this surface is a backbuffer.  It is generally
00858  * set by CreateSurface when the DDSCAPS_FLIP capability bit is set.
00859  * It indicates that this surface is THE back buffer of a surface
00860  * flipping structure.  DirectDraw supports N surfaces in a
00861  * surface flipping structure.  Only the surface that immediately
00862  * precedeces the DDSCAPS_FRONTBUFFER has this capability bit set.
00863  * The other surfaces are identified as back buffers by the presence
00864  * of the DDSCAPS_FLIP capability, their attachment order, and the
00865  * absence of the DDSCAPS_FRONTBUFFER and DDSCAPS_BACKBUFFER
00866  * capabilities.  The bit is sent to CreateSurface when a standalone
00867  * back buffer is being created.  This surface could be attached to
00868  * a front buffer and/or back buffers to form a flipping surface
00869  * structure after the CreateSurface call.  See AddAttachments for
00870  * a detailed description of the behaviors in this case.
00871  */
00872 #define DDSCAPS_BACKBUFFER                      0x00000004l
00873 
00874 /*
00875  * Indicates a complex surface structure is being described.  A
00876  * complex surface structure results in the creation of more than
00877  * one surface.  The additional surfaces are attached to the root
00878  * surface.  The complex structure can only be destroyed by
00879  * destroying the root.
00880  */
00881 #define DDSCAPS_COMPLEX                         0x00000008l
00882 
00883 /*
00884  * Indicates that this surface is a part of a surface flipping structure.
00885  * When it is passed to CreateSurface the DDSCAPS_FRONTBUFFER and
00886  * DDSCAP_BACKBUFFER bits are not set.  They are set by CreateSurface
00887  * on the resulting creations.  The dwBackBufferCount field in the
00888  * DDSURFACEDESC structure must be set to at least 1 in order for
00889  * the CreateSurface call to succeed.  The DDSCAPS_COMPLEX capability
00890  * must always be set with creating multiple surfaces through CreateSurface.
00891  */
00892 #define DDSCAPS_FLIP                            0x00000010l
00893 
00894 /*
00895  * Indicates that this surface is THE front buffer of a surface flipping
00896  * structure.  It is generally set by CreateSurface when the DDSCAPS_FLIP
00897  * capability bit is set.
00898  * If this capability is sent to CreateSurface then a standalonw front buffer
00899  * is created.  This surface will not have the DDSCAPS_FLIP capability.
00900  * It can be attached to other back buffers to form a flipping structure.
00901  * See AddAttachments for a detailed description of the behaviors in this
00902  * case.
00903  */
00904 #define DDSCAPS_FRONTBUFFER                     0x00000020l
00905 
00906 /*
00907  * Indicates that this surface is any offscreen surface that is not an overlay,
00908  * texture, zbuffer, front buffer, back buffer, or alpha surface.  It is used
00909  * to identify plain vanilla surfaces.
00910  */
00911 #define DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN                  0x00000040l
00912 
00913 /*
00914  * Indicates that this surface is an overlay.  It may or may not be directly visible
00915  * depending on whether or not it is currently being overlayed onto the primary 
00916  * surface.  DDSCAPS_VISIBLE can be used to determine whether or not it is being 
00917  * overlayed at the moment. 
00918  */
00919 #define DDSCAPS_OVERLAY                         0x00000080l
00920 
00921 /*
00922  * Indicates that unique DirectDrawPalette objects can be created and
00923  * attached to this surface.
00924  */
00925 #define DDSCAPS_PALETTE                         0x00000100l
00926 
00927 /*
00928  * Indicates that this surface is the primary surface.  The primary
00929  * surface represents what the user is seeing at the moment.
00930  */
00931 #define DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE                  0x00000200l
00932 
00933 /*
00934  * Indicates that this surface is the primary surface for the left eye.
00935  * The primary surface for the left eye represents what the user is seeing
00936  * at the moment with the users left eye.  When this surface is created the
00937  * DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE represents what the user is seeing with the users
00938  * right eye.
00939  */
00940 #define DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACELEFT              0x00000400l
00941 
00942 /*
00943  * Indicates that this surface memory was allocated in system memory
00944  */
00945 #define DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY                    0x00000800l
00946 
00947 /*
00948  * Indicates that this surface can be used as a 3D texture.  It does not
00949  * indicate whether or not the surface is being used for that purpose.
00950  */
00951 #define DDSCAPS_TEXTURE                         0x00001000l
00952 
00953 /*
00954  * Indicates that a surface may be a destination for 3D rendering.  This
00955  * bit must be set in order to query for a Direct3D Device Interface 
00956  * from this surface.
00957  */
00958 #define DDSCAPS_3DDEVICE                        0x00002000l
00959 
00960 /*
00961  * Indicates that this surface exists in video memory.
00962  */
00963 #define DDSCAPS_VIDEOMEMORY                     0x00004000l
00964 
00965 /*
00966  * Indicates that changes made to this surface are immediately visible.  
00967  * It is always set for the primary surface and is set for overlays while
00968  * they are being overlayed and texture maps while they are being textured.
00969  */
00970 #define DDSCAPS_VISIBLE                         0x00008000l
00971 
00972 /*
00973  * Indicates that only writes are permitted to the surface.  Read accesses 
00974  * from the surface may or may not generate a protection fault, but the 
00975  * results of a read from this surface will not be meaningful.  READ ONLY.
00976  */
00977 #define DDSCAPS_WRITEONLY                       0x00010000l
00978 
00979 /*
00980  * Indicates that this surface is a z buffer. A z buffer does not contain
00981  * displayable information.  Instead it contains bit depth information that is
00982  * used to determine which pixels are visible and which are obscured. 
00983  */
00984 #define DDSCAPS_ZBUFFER                         0x00020000l
00985 
00986 /*
00987  * Indicates surface will have a DC associated long term
00988  */
00989 #define DDSCAPS_OWNDC                           0x00040000l
00990 
00991 /*
00992  * Indicates surface should be able to receive live video
00993  */
00994 #define DDSCAPS_LIVEVIDEO                       0x00080000l
00995 
00996 /*
00997  * Indicates surface should be able to have a stream decompressed
00998  * to it by the hardware.
00999  */
01000 #define DDSCAPS_HWCODEC                         0x00100000l
01001 
01002 /*
01003  * Surface is a 320x200 or 320x240 ModeX surface
01004  */
01005 #define DDSCAPS_MODEX                           0x00200000l
01006 
01007 /*
01008  * Indicates surface is one level of a mip-map. This surface will
01009  * be attached to other DDSCAPS_MIPMAP surfaces to form the mip-map.
01010  * This can be done explicitly, by creating a number of surfaces and
01011  * attaching them with AddAttachedSurface or by implicitly by CreateSurface.
01012  * If this bit is set then DDSCAPS_TEXTURE must also be set.
01013  */
01014 #define DDSCAPS_MIPMAP                          0x00400000l
01015 
01016 
01017 
01018 /*
01019  * Indicates that memory for the surface is not allocated until the surface
01020  * is loaded (via the Direct3D texture Load() function).
01021  */
01022 #define DDSCAPS_ALLOCONLOAD                     0x04000000l
01023 
01024 
01025 
01026  /****************************************************************************
01027  *
01028  * DIRECTDRAW DRIVER CAPABILITY FLAGS
01029  *
01030  ****************************************************************************/
01031 
01032 /*
01033  * Display hardware has 3D acceleration.
01034  */
01035 #define DDCAPS_3D                       0x00000001l
01036 
01037 /*
01038  * Indicates that DirectDraw will support only dest rectangles that are aligned
01039  * on DIRECTDRAWCAPS.dwAlignBoundaryDest boundaries of the surface, respectively.
01040  * READ ONLY.
01041  */
01042 #define DDCAPS_ALIGNBOUNDARYDEST        0x00000002l
01043 
01044 /*
01045  * Indicates that DirectDraw will support only source rectangles  whose sizes in 
01046  * BYTEs are DIRECTDRAWCAPS.dwAlignSizeDest multiples, respectively.  READ ONLY.
01047  */
01048 #define DDCAPS_ALIGNSIZEDEST            0x00000004l
01049 /*
01050  * Indicates that DirectDraw will support only source rectangles that are aligned
01051  * on DIRECTDRAWCAPS.dwAlignBoundarySrc boundaries of the surface, respectively.
01052  * READ ONLY.
01053  */
01054 #define DDCAPS_ALIGNBOUNDARYSRC         0x00000008l
01055 
01056 /*
01057  * Indicates that DirectDraw will support only source rectangles  whose sizes in 
01058  * BYTEs are DIRECTDRAWCAPS.dwAlignSizeSrc multiples, respectively.  READ ONLY.
01059  */
01060 #define DDCAPS_ALIGNSIZESRC             0x00000010l
01061 
01062 /*
01063  * Indicates that DirectDraw will create video memory surfaces that have a stride 
01064  * alignment equal to DIRECTDRAWCAPS.dwAlignStride.  READ ONLY.
01065  */
01066 #define DDCAPS_ALIGNSTRIDE              0x00000020l
01067 
01068 /*
01069  * Display hardware is capable of blt operations.
01070  */
01071 #define DDCAPS_BLT                      0x00000040l
01072 
01073 /*
01074  * Display hardware is capable of asynchronous blt operations.
01075  */
01076 #define DDCAPS_BLTQUEUE                 0x00000080l
01077 
01078 /*
01079  * Display hardware is capable of color space conversions during the blt operation.
01080  */
01081 #define DDCAPS_BLTFOURCC                0x00000100l
01082 
01083 /*
01084  * Display hardware is capable of stretching during blt operations.
01085  */
01086 #define DDCAPS_BLTSTRETCH               0x00000200l
01087 
01088 /*
01089  * Display hardware is shared with GDI.
01090  */
01091 #define DDCAPS_GDI                      0x00000400l
01092 
01093 /*
01094  * Display hardware can overlay.
01095  */
01096 #define DDCAPS_OVERLAY                  0x00000800l
01097 
01098 /*
01099  * Set if display hardware supports overlays but can not clip them.
01100  */
01101 #define DDCAPS_OVERLAYCANTCLIP          0x00001000l
01102 
01103 /*
01104  * Indicates that overlay hardware is capable of color space conversions during
01105  * the overlay operation.
01106  */
01107 #define DDCAPS_OVERLAYFOURCC            0x00002000l
01108 
01109 /*
01110  * Indicates that stretching can be done by the overlay hardware.
01111  */
01112 #define DDCAPS_OVERLAYSTRETCH           0x00004000l
01113 
01114 /*
01115  * Indicates that unique DirectDrawPalettes can be created for DirectDrawSurfaces
01116  * other than the primary surface.
01117  */
01118 #define DDCAPS_PALETTE                  0x00008000l
01119 
01120 /*
01121  * Indicates that palette changes can be syncd with the veritcal refresh.
01122  */
01123 #define DDCAPS_PALETTEVSYNC             0x00010000l
01124 
01125 /*
01126  * Display hardware can return the current scan line.
01127  */
01128 #define DDCAPS_READSCANLINE             0x00020000l
01129 
01130 /*
01131  * Display hardware has stereo vision capabilities.  DDSCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACELEFT 
01132  * can be created.
01133  */
01134 #define DDCAPS_STEREOVIEW               0x00040000l
01135 
01136 /*
01137  * Display hardware is capable of generating a vertical blank interrupt.
01138  */
01139 #define DDCAPS_VBI                      0x00080000l
01140 
01141 /*
01142  * Supports the use of z buffers with blt operations.
01143  */
01144 #define DDCAPS_ZBLTS                    0x00100000l
01145 
01146 /*
01147  * Supports Z Ordering of overlays.
01148  */
01149 #define DDCAPS_ZOVERLAYS                0x00200000l
01150 
01151 /*
01152  * Supports color key
01153  */
01154 #define DDCAPS_COLORKEY                 0x00400000l
01155 
01156 /*
01157  * Supports alpha surfaces
01158  */
01159 #define DDCAPS_ALPHA                    0x00800000l
01160 
01161 /*
01162  * colorkey is hardware assisted(DDCAPS_COLORKEY will also be set)
01163  */
01164 #define DDCAPS_COLORKEYHWASSIST         0x01000000l
01165 
01166 /*
01167  * no hardware support at all
01168  */
01169 #define DDCAPS_NOHARDWARE               0x02000000l
01170 
01171 /*
01172  * Display hardware is capable of color fill with bltter
01173  */
01174 #define DDCAPS_BLTCOLORFILL             0x04000000l
01175 
01176 /*
01177  * Display hardware is bank switched, and potentially very slow at
01178  * random access to VRAM.
01179  */
01180 #define DDCAPS_BANKSWITCHED             0x08000000l
01181 
01182 /*
01183  * Display hardware is capable of depth filling Z-buffers with bltter
01184  */
01185 #define DDCAPS_BLTDEPTHFILL             0x10000000l
01186 
01187 /*
01188  * Display hardware is capable of clipping while bltting.
01189  */
01190 #define DDCAPS_CANCLIP                  0x20000000l
01191 
01192 /*
01193  * Display hardware is capable of clipping while stretch bltting.
01194  */
01195 #define DDCAPS_CANCLIPSTRETCHED         0x40000000l
01196 
01197 /*
01198  * Display hardware is capable of bltting to or from system memory
01199  */
01200 #define DDCAPS_CANBLTSYSMEM             0x80000000l
01201

01203  /****************************************************************************
01204  *
01205  * MORE DIRECTDRAW DRIVER CAPABILITY FLAGS (dwCaps2)
01206  *
01207  ****************************************************************************/
01208 
01209 /*
01210  * Display hardware is certified
01211  */
01212 #define DDCAPS2_CERTIFIED               0x00000001l
01213 
01214 /*
01215  * Driver cannot interleave 2D operations (lock and blt) to surfaces with
01216  * Direct3D rendering operations between calls to BeginScene() and EndScene()
01217  */
01218 #define DDCAPS2_NO2DDURING3DSCENE       0x00000002l
01219 
01220 /****************************************************************************
01221  *
01222  * DIRECTDRAW FX ALPHA CAPABILITY FLAGS
01223  *
01224  ****************************************************************************/
01225 
01226 /*
01227  * Supports alpha blending around the edge of a source color keyed surface.
01228  * For Blt.
01229  */
01230 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_BLTALPHAEDGEBLEND         0x00000001l
01231 
01232 /*
01233  * Supports alpha information in the pixel format.  The bit depth of alpha 
01234  * information in the pixel format can be 1,2,4, or 8.  The alpha value becomes
01235  * more opaque as the alpha value increases.  (0 is transparent.)
01236  * For Blt.
01237  */
01238 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_BLTALPHAPIXELS            0x00000002l
01239 
01240 /*
01241  * Supports alpha information in the pixel format.  The bit depth of alpha 
01242  * information in the pixel format can be 1,2,4, or 8.  The alpha value 
01243  * becomes more transparent as the alpha value increases.  (0 is opaque.) 
01244  * This flag can only be set if DDCAPS_ALPHA is set.
01245  * For Blt.
01246  */
01247 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_BLTALPHAPIXELSNEG         0x00000004l
01248 
01249 /*
01250  * Supports alpha only surfaces.  The bit depth of an alpha only surface can be
01251  * 1,2,4, or 8.  The alpha value becomes more opaque as the alpha value increases.
01252  * (0 is transparent.)
01253  * For Blt.
01254  */
01255 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_BLTALPHASURFACES          0x00000008l
01256 
01257 /*
01258  * The depth of the alpha channel data can range can be 1,2,4, or 8.  
01259  * The NEG suffix indicates that this alpha channel becomes more transparent
01260  * as the alpha value increases. (0 is opaque.)  This flag can only be set if
01261  * DDCAPS_ALPHA is set.
01262  * For Blt.
01263  */
01264 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_BLTALPHASURFACESNEG       0x00000010l
01265 
01266 /*
01267  * Supports alpha blending around the edge of a source color keyed surface.
01268  * For Overlays.
01269  */
01270 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_OVERLAYALPHAEDGEBLEND     0x00000020l
01271 
01272 /*
01273  * Supports alpha information in the pixel format.  The bit depth of alpha 
01274  * information in the pixel format can be 1,2,4, or 8.  The alpha value becomes
01275  * more opaque as the alpha value increases.  (0 is transparent.)
01276  * For Overlays.
01277  */
01278 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_OVERLAYALPHAPIXELS        0x00000040l
01279 
01280 /*
01281  * Supports alpha information in the pixel format.  The bit depth of alpha 
01282  * information in the pixel format can be 1,2,4, or 8.  The alpha value 
01283  * becomes more transparent as the alpha value increases.  (0 is opaque.) 
01284  * This flag can only be set if DDCAPS_ALPHA is set.
01285  * For Overlays.
01286  */
01287 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_OVERLAYALPHAPIXELSNEG     0x00000080l
01288 
01289 /*
01290  * Supports alpha only surfaces.  The bit depth of an alpha only surface can be
01291  * 1,2,4, or 8.  The alpha value becomes more opaque as the alpha value increases.
01292  * (0 is transparent.)
01293  * For Overlays.
01294  */
01295 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_OVERLAYALPHASURFACES      0x00000100l
01296 
01297 /*
01298  * The depth of the alpha channel data can range can be 1,2,4, or 8.  
01299  * The NEG suffix indicates that this alpha channel becomes more transparent
01300  * as the alpha value increases. (0 is opaque.)  This flag can only be set if
01301  * DDCAPS_ALPHA is set.
01302  * For Overlays.
01303  */
01304 #define DDFXALPHACAPS_OVERLAYALPHASURFACESNEG   0x00000200l

01312 /*

01314  * rather than pixel doubling techniques.  Along the Y axis.
01315  */
01316 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTARITHSTRETCHY       0x00000020l
01317 
01318 /*
01319  * Uses arithmetic operations to stretch during blt
01320  * rather than pixel doubling techniques.  Along the Y axis. Only
01321  * works for x1, x2, etc.
01322  */
01323 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTARITHSTRETCHYN      0x00000010l
01324

01327  */
01328 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTMIRRORLEFTRIGHT     0x00000040l

01349 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTSHRINKX             0x00000400l

01355 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTSHRINKXN            0x00000800l

01373 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTSTRETCHX            0x00004000l

01379 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTSTRETCHXN           0x00008000l
01380

01384  */
01385 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTSTRETCHY            0x00010000l
01386 
01387 /*

01390  */
01391 #define DDFXCAPS_BLTSTRETCHYN           0x00020000l
01392

01395  * overlay rather than pixel doubling techniques.  Along the Y axis 
01396  * for overlays.
01397  */
01398 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYARITHSTRETCHY   0x00040000l

01405 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYARITHSTRETCHYN  0x00000008l

01417 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYSHRINKXN        0x00100000l
01418 
01419 /*
01420  * DirectDraw supports arbitrary shrinking of a surface along the
01421  * y axis (horizontal direction) for overlays.  
01422  */
01423 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYSHRINKY         0x00200000l
01424 
01425 /*
01426  * DirectDraw supports integer shrinking (1x,2x,) of a surface
01427  * along the y axis (vertical direction) for overlays.  
01428  */
01429 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYSHRINKYN        0x00400000l
01430 
01431 /*
01432  * DirectDraw supports arbitrary stretching of a surface along the
01433  * x axis (horizontal direction) for overlays.
01434  */
01435 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYSTRETCHX        0x00800000l
01436 
01437 /*
01438  * DirectDraw supports integer stretching (1x,2x,) of a surface
01439  * along the x axis (horizontal direction) for overlays.
01440  */
01441 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYSTRETCHXN       0x01000000l
01442 
01443 /*
01444  * DirectDraw supports arbitrary stretching of a surface along the
01445  * y axis (horizontal direction) for overlays.  
01446  */
01447 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYSTRETCHY        0x02000000l
01448 
01449 /*
01450  * DirectDraw supports integer stretching (1x,2x,) of a surface
01451  * along the y axis (vertical direction) for overlays.  
01452  */
01453 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYSTRETCHYN       0x04000000l
01454 
01455 /*
01456  * DirectDraw supports mirroring of overlays across the vertical axis
01457  */
01458 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYMIRRORLEFTRIGHT 0x08000000l
01459 
01460 /*
01461  * DirectDraw supports mirroring of overlays across the horizontal axis
01462  */
01463 #define DDFXCAPS_OVERLAYMIRRORUPDOWN    0x10000000l
01464 
01465 /****************************************************************************
01466  *
01467  * DIRECTDRAW STEREO VIEW CAPABILITIES
01468  *
01469  ****************************************************************************/
01470 
01471 /*
01472  * The stereo view is accomplished via enigma encoding.
01473  */
01474 #define DDSVCAPS_ENIGMA                 0x00000001l
01475 
01476 /*
01477  * The stereo view is accomplished via high frequency flickering.
01478  */
01479 #define DDSVCAPS_FLICKER                0x00000002l
01480 
01481 /*
01482  * The stereo view is accomplished via red and blue filters applied
01483  * to the left and right eyes.  All images must adapt their colorspaces
01484  * for this process.
01485  */
01486 #define DDSVCAPS_REDBLUE                0x00000004l
01487 
01488 /*
01489  * The stereo view is accomplished with split screen technology.
01490  */
01491 #define DDSVCAPS_SPLIT                  0x00000008l
01492 
01493 /****************************************************************************
01494  *
01495  * DIRECTDRAWPALETTE CAPABILITIES
01496  *
01497  ****************************************************************************/
01498 
01499 /*
01500  * Index is 4 bits.  There are sixteen color entries in the palette table.
01501  */
01502 #define DDPCAPS_4BIT                    0x00000001l
01503 
01504 /*
01505  * Index is onto a 8 bit color index.  This field is only valid with the
01506  * DDPCAPS_1BIT, DDPCAPS_2BIT or DDPCAPS_4BIT capability and the target
01507  * surface is in 8bpp. Each color entry is one byte long and is an index
01508  * into destination surface's 8bpp palette.
01509  */
01510 #define DDPCAPS_8BITENTRIES             0x00000002l
01511 
01512 /*
01513  * Index is 8 bits.  There are 256 color entries in the palette table.
01514  */
01515 #define DDPCAPS_8BIT                    0x00000004l
01516 
01517 /*
01518  * Indicates that this DIRECTDRAWPALETTE should use the palette color array
01519  * passed into the lpDDColorArray parameter to initialize the DIRECTDRAWPALETTE
01520  * object.
01521  */
01522 #define DDPCAPS_INITIALIZE              0x00000008l
01523 
01524 /*
01525  * This palette is the one attached to the primary surface.  Changing this
01526  * table has immediate effect on the display unless DDPSETPAL_VSYNC is specified
01527  * and supported.
01528  */
01529 #define DDPCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACE          0x00000010l
01530 
01531 /*
01532  * This palette is the one attached to the primary surface left.  Changing
01533  * this table has immediate effect on the display for the left eye unless
01534  * DDPSETPAL_VSYNC is specified and supported.
01535  */
01536 #define DDPCAPS_PRIMARYSURFACELEFT      0x00000020l
01537 
01538 /*
01539  * This palette can have all 256 entries defined
01540  */
01541 #define DDPCAPS_ALLOW256                0x00000040l
01542 
01543 /*
01544  * This palette can have modifications to it synced with the monitors
01545  * refresh rate.
01546  */
01547 #define DDPCAPS_VSYNC                   0x00000080l
01548 
01549 /*
01550  * Index is 1 bit.  There are two color entries in the palette table.
01551  */
01552 #define DDPCAPS_1BIT                    0x00000100l
01553 
01554 /*
01555  * Index is 2 bit.  There are four color entries in the palette table.
01556  */
01557 #define DDPCAPS_2BIT                    0x00000200l
01558

01582 /****************************************************************************
01583  *
01584  * DIRECTDRAW BITDEPTH CONSTANTS
01585  *
01586  * NOTE:  These are only used to indicate supported bit depths.   These
01587  * are flags only, they are not to be used as an actual bit depth.   The
01588  * absolute numbers 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 24 and 32 are used to indicate actual
01589  * bit depths in a surface or for changing the display mode.
01590  *
01591  ****************************************************************************/
01592 
01593 /*
01594  * 1 bit per pixel.
01595  */
01596 #define DDBD_1                  0x00004000l
01597 
01598 /*
01599  * 2 bits per pixel.
01600  */
01601 #define DDBD_2                  0x00002000l
01602 
01603 /*
01604  * 4 bits per pixel.
01605  */
01606 #define DDBD_4                  0x00001000l
01607 
01608 /*
01609  * 8 bits per pixel.
01610  */
01611 #define DDBD_8                  0x00000800l
01612 
01613 /*
01614  * 16 bits per pixel.
01615  */
01616 #define DDBD_16                 0x00000400l
01617 
01618 /*
01619  * 24 bits per pixel.
01620  */
01621 #define DDBD_24                 0X00000200l
01622 
01623 /*
01624  * 32 bits per pixel.
01625  */
01626 #define DDBD_32                 0x00000100l

01634 /*
01635  * Set if the structure contains a color space.  Not set if the structure
01636  * contains a single color key.
01637  */
01638 #define DDCKEY_COLORSPACE       0x00000001l
01639 
01640 /*
01641  * Set if the structure specifies a color key or color space which is to be
01642  * used as a destination color key for blt operations.
01643  */

01645 
01646 /*

01648  * used as a destination color key for overlay operations.
01649  */

01651

01654  * used as a source color key for blt operations.
01655  */
01656 #define DDCKEY_SRCBLT           0x00000008l
01657 
01658 /*
01659  * Set if the structure specifies a color key or color space which is to be
01660  * used as a source color key for overlay operations.
01661  */
01662 #define DDCKEY_SRCOVERLAY       0x00000010l

01673  * bits of the destination surface for RGB colors.

01675 #define DDCKEYCAPS_DESTBLT                      0x00000001l
01676 
01677 /*

01679  * bits of the destination surface for RGB colors.

01681 #define DDCKEYCAPS_DESTBLTCLRSPACE              0x00000002l
01682 
01683 /*

01685  * bits of the destination surface for YUV colors.
01686  */
01687 #define DDCKEYCAPS_DESTBLTCLRSPACEYUV           0x00000004l
01688 
01689 /*
01690  * Supports transparent blting using a color key to identify the replaceable 
01691  * bits of the destination surface for YUV colors.
01692  */
01693 #define DDCKEYCAPS_DESTBLTYUV                   0x00000008l
01694 
01695 /*
01696  * Supports overlaying using colorkeying of the replaceable bits of the surface
01697  * being overlayed for RGB colors.
01698  */
01699 #define DDCKEYCAPS_DESTOVERLAY                  0x00000010l

01701 /*

01710

01712  * Supports only one active destination color key value for visible overlay
01713  * surfaces.
01714  */

01716

01718  * Supports overlaying using colorkeying of the replaceable bits of the 
01719  * surface being overlayed for YUV colors.
01720  */
01721 #define DDCKEYCAPS_DESTOVERLAYYUV               0x00000100l
01722 
01723 /*
01724  * Supports transparent blting using the color key for the source with
01725  * this surface for RGB colors.
01726  */
01727 #define DDCKEYCAPS_SRCBLT                       0x00000200l

01731  * this surface for RGB colors.

01745 #define DDCKEYCAPS_SRCBLTYUV                    0x00001000l

01749  * overlay surface for RGB colors.
01750  */
01751 #define DDCKEYCAPS_SRCOVERLAY                   0x00002000l

01755  * the overlay surface for RGB colors.

01774  */
01775 #define DDCKEYCAPS_SRCOVERLAYYUV                0x00020000l

01779  */

01783 /****************************************************************************
01784  *
01785  * DIRECTDRAW PIXELFORMAT FLAGS
01786  *
01787  ****************************************************************************/
01788 
01789 /*
01790  * The surface has alpha channel information in the pixel format.
01791  */
01792 #define DDPF_ALPHAPIXELS                        0x00000001l
01793 
01794 /*
01795  * The pixel format contains alpha only information
01796  */
01797 #define DDPF_ALPHA                              0x00000002l
01798 
01799 /*
01800  * The FourCC code is valid.
01801  */
01802 #define DDPF_FOURCC                             0x00000004l
01803 
01804 /*
01805  * The surface is 4-bit color indexed.
01806  */
01807 #define DDPF_PALETTEINDEXED4                    0x00000008l
01808 
01809 /*
01810  * The surface is indexed into a palette which stores indices
01811  * into the destination surface's 8-bit palette.
01812  */
01813 #define DDPF_PALETTEINDEXEDTO8                  0x00000010l
01814 
01815 /*
01816  * The surface is 8-bit color indexed.
01817  */
01818 #define DDPF_PALETTEINDEXED8                    0x00000020l
01819 
01820 /*
01821  * The RGB data in the pixel format structure is valid.
01822  */
01823 #define DDPF_RGB                                0x00000040l
01824 
01825 /*
01826  * The surface will accept pixel data in the format specified
01827  * and compress it during the write.
01828  */
01829 #define DDPF_COMPRESSED                         0x00000080l
01830 
01831 /*
01832  * The surface will accept RGB data and translate it during
01833  * the write to YUV data.  The format of the data to be written
01834  * will be contained in the pixel format structure.  The DDPF_RGB
01835  * flag will be set. 
01836  */
01837 #define DDPF_RGBTOYUV                           0x00000100l
01838 
01839 /*
01840  * pixel format is YUV - YUV data in pixel format struct is valid
01841  */
01842 #define DDPF_YUV                                0x00000200l
01843 
01844 /*
01845  * pixel format is a z buffer only surface
01846  */
01847 #define DDPF_ZBUFFER                            0x00000400l
01848 
01849 /*
01850  * The surface is 1-bit color indexed.
01851  */
01852 #define DDPF_PALETTEINDEXED1                    0x00000800l
01853 
01854 /*
01855  * The surface is 2-bit color indexed.
01856  */
01857 #define DDPF_PALETTEINDEXED2                    0x00001000l

01867 /****************************************************************************
01868  *
01869  * DIRECTDRAW ENUMSURFACES FLAGS
01870  *
01871  ****************************************************************************/
01872 
01873 /*
01874  * Enumerate all of the surfaces that meet the search criterion.
01875  */
01876 #define DDENUMSURFACES_ALL                      0x00000001l
01877 
01878 /*
01879  * A search hit is a surface that matches the surface description.
01880  */
01881 #define DDENUMSURFACES_MATCH                    0x00000002l
01882 
01883 /*
01884  * A search hit is a surface that does not match the surface description.
01885  */
01886 #define DDENUMSURFACES_NOMATCH                  0x00000004l
01887 
01888 /*
01889  * Enumerate the first surface that can be created which meets the search criterion.
01890  */
01891 #define DDENUMSURFACES_CANBECREATED             0x00000008l
01892 
01893 /*
01894  * Enumerate the surfaces that already exist that meet the search criterion.
01895  */
01896 #define DDENUMSURFACES_DOESEXIST                0x00000010l
01897 
01898 
01899 /****************************************************************************
01900  *
01901  * DIRECTDRAW ENUMDISPLAYMODES FLAGS
01902  *
01903  ****************************************************************************/
01904 
01905 /*
01906  * Enumerate Modes with different refresh rates.  EnumDisplayModes guarantees
01907  * that a particular mode will be enumerated only once.  This flag specifies whether
01908  * the refresh rate is taken into account when determining if a mode is unique.
01909  */
01910 #define DDEDM_REFRESHRATES                      0x00000001l
01911 
01912 
01913 /****************************************************************************
01914  *
01915  * DIRECTDRAW SETCOOPERATIVELEVEL FLAGS
01916  *
01917  ****************************************************************************/
01918 
01919 /*
01920  * Exclusive mode owner will be responsible for the entire primary surface.
01921  * GDI can be ignored. used with DD
01922  */
01923 #define DDSCL_FULLSCREEN                        0x00000001l
01924 
01925 /*
01926  * allow CTRL_ALT_DEL to work while in fullscreen exclusive mode 
01927  */
01928 #define DDSCL_ALLOWREBOOT                       0x00000002l
01929 
01930 /*
01931  * prevents DDRAW from modifying the application window.
01932  * prevents DDRAW from minimize/restore the application window on activation.
01933  */
01934 #define DDSCL_NOWINDOWCHANGES                   0x00000004l
01935 
01936 /*
01937  * app wants to work as a regular Windows application
01938  */
01939 #define DDSCL_NORMAL                            0x00000008l
01940 
01941 /*
01942  * app wants exclusive access
01943  */
01944 #define DDSCL_EXCLUSIVE                         0x00000010l
01945 
01946 
01947 /*
01948  * app can deal with non-windows display modes
01949  */
01950 #define DDSCL_ALLOWMODEX                        0x00000040l
01951 
01952 
01953 /****************************************************************************
01954  *
01955  * DIRECTDRAW BLT FLAGS
01956  *
01957  ****************************************************************************/
01958 
01959 /*
01960  * Use the alpha information in the pixel format or the alpha channel surface
01961  * attached to the destination surface as the alpha channel for this blt.
01962  */
01963 #define DDBLT_ALPHADEST                         0x00000001l
01964 
01965 /*
01966  * Use the dwConstAlphaDest field in the DDBLTFX structure as the alpha channel
01967  * for the destination surface for this blt.
01968  */
01969 #define DDBLT_ALPHADESTCONSTOVERRIDE            0x00000002l
01970 
01971 /*
01972  * The NEG suffix indicates that the destination surface becomes more
01973  * transparent as the alpha value increases. (0 is opaque)
01974  */
01975 #define DDBLT_ALPHADESTNEG                      0x00000004l
01976 
01977 /*
01978  * Use the lpDDSAlphaDest field in the DDBLTFX structure as the alpha
01979  * channel for the destination for this blt.
01980  */
01981 #define DDBLT_ALPHADESTSURFACEOVERRIDE          0x00000008l
01982 
01983 /*
01984  * Use the dwAlphaEdgeBlend field in the DDBLTFX structure as the alpha channel
01985  * for the edges of the image that border the color key colors.
01986  */
01987 #define DDBLT_ALPHAEDGEBLEND                    0x00000010l
01988 
01989 /*
01990  * Use the alpha information in the pixel format or the alpha channel surface
01991  * attached to the source surface as the alpha channel for this blt.
01992  */
01993 #define DDBLT_ALPHASRC                          0x00000020l
01994 
01995 /*
01996  * Use the dwConstAlphaSrc field in the DDBLTFX structure as the alpha channel
01997  * for the source for this blt.
01998  */
01999 #define DDBLT_ALPHASRCCONSTOVERRIDE             0x00000040l
02000 
02001 /*
02002  * The NEG suffix indicates that the source surface becomes more transparent
02003  * as the alpha value increases. (0 is opaque)
02004  */
02005 #define DDBLT_ALPHASRCNEG                       0x00000080l
02006 
02007 /*
02008  * Use the lpDDSAlphaSrc field in the DDBLTFX structure as the alpha channel
02009  * for the source for this blt. 
02010  */
02011 #define DDBLT_ALPHASRCSURFACEOVERRIDE           0x00000100l
02012 
02013 /*
02014  * Do this blt asynchronously through the FIFO in the order received.  If
02015  * there is no room in the hardware FIFO fail the call.
02016  */
02017 #define DDBLT_ASYNC                             0x00000200l
02018 
02019 /*
02020  * Uses the dwFillColor field in the DDBLTFX structure as the RGB color
02021  * to fill the destination rectangle on the destination surface with.
02022  */
02023 #define DDBLT_COLORFILL                         0x00000400l
02024 
02025 /*
02026  * Uses the dwDDFX field in the DDBLTFX structure to specify the effects
02027  * to use for the blt.
02028  */
02029 #define DDBLT_DDFX                              0x00000800l
02030 
02031 /*
02032  * Uses the dwDDROPS field in the DDBLTFX structure to specify the ROPS
02033  * that are not part of the Win32 API.
02034  */
02035 #define DDBLT_DDROPS                            0x00001000l
02036 
02037 /*
02038  * Use the color key associated with the destination surface.
02039  */
02040 #define DDBLT_KEYDEST                           0x00002000l
02041 
02042 /*
02043  * Use the dckDestColorkey field in the DDBLTFX structure as the color key
02044  * for the destination surface.
02045  */
02046 #define DDBLT_KEYDESTOVERRIDE                   0x00004000l
02047 
02048 /*
02049  * Use the color key associated with the source surface.
02050  */
02051 #define DDBLT_KEYSRC                            0x00008000l
02052 
02053 /*
02054  * Use the dckSrcColorkey field in the DDBLTFX structure as the color key
02055  * for the source surface.
02056  */
02057 #define DDBLT_KEYSRCOVERRIDE                    0x00010000l
02058 
02059 /*
02060  * Use the dwROP field in the DDBLTFX structure for the raster operation
02061  * for this blt.  These ROPs are the same as the ones defined in the Win32 API.
02062  */
02063 #define DDBLT_ROP                               0x00020000l
02064 
02065 /*
02066  * Use the dwRotationAngle field in the DDBLTFX structure as the angle
02067  * (specified in 1/100th of a degree) to rotate the surface.
02068  */
02069 #define DDBLT_ROTATIONANGLE                     0x00040000l
02070 
02071 /*
02072  * Z-buffered blt using the z-buffers attached to the source and destination
02073  * surfaces and the dwZBufferOpCode field in the DDBLTFX structure as the
02074  * z-buffer opcode.
02075  */
02076 #define DDBLT_ZBUFFER                           0x00080000l
02077 
02078 /*
02079  * Z-buffered blt using the dwConstDest Zfield and the dwZBufferOpCode field
02080  * in the DDBLTFX structure as the z-buffer and z-buffer opcode respectively
02081  * for the destination.
02082  */
02083 #define DDBLT_ZBUFFERDESTCONSTOVERRIDE          0x00100000l
02084 
02085 /*
02086  * Z-buffered blt using the lpDDSDestZBuffer field and the dwZBufferOpCode
02087  * field in the DDBLTFX structure as the z-buffer and z-buffer opcode
02088  * respectively for the destination.
02089  */
02090 #define DDBLT_ZBUFFERDESTOVERRIDE               0x00200000l
02091 
02092 /*
02093  * Z-buffered blt using the dwConstSrcZ field and the dwZBufferOpCode field
02094  * in the DDBLTFX structure as the z-buffer and z-buffer opcode respectively
02095  * for the source.
02096  */
02097 #define DDBLT_ZBUFFERSRCCONSTOVERRIDE           0x00400000l
02098 
02099 /*
02100  * Z-buffered blt using the lpDDSSrcZBuffer field and the dwZBufferOpCode
02101  * field in the DDBLTFX structure as the z-buffer and z-buffer opcode
02102  * respectively for the source.
02103  */
02104 #define DDBLT_ZBUFFERSRCOVERRIDE                0x00800000l
02105 
02106 /*
02107  * wait until the device is ready to handle the blt
02108  * this will cause blt to not return DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING
02109  */
02110 #define DDBLT_WAIT                              0x01000000l
02111 
02112 /*
02113  * Uses the dwFillDepth field in the DDBLTFX structure as the depth value
02114  * to fill the destination rectangle on the destination Z-buffer surface
02115  * with.
02116  */
02117 #define DDBLT_DEPTHFILL                         0x02000000l
02118

02141  *

02143  *
02144  ****************************************************************************/
02145 
02146 /*
02147  * Use the alpha information in the pixel format or the alpha channel surface
02148  * attached to the destination surface as the alpha channel for the
02149  * destination overlay.
02150  */
02151 #define DDOVER_ALPHADEST                        0x00000001l
02152

02154  * Use the dwConstAlphaDest field in the DDOVERLAYFX structure as the
02155  * destination alpha channel for this overlay.
02156  */
02157 #define DDOVER_ALPHADESTCONSTOVERRIDE           0x00000002l
02158 
02159 /*
02160  * The NEG suffix indicates that the destination surface becomes more
02161  * transparent as the alpha value increases. 
02162  */
02163 #define DDOVER_ALPHADESTNEG                     0x00000004l
02164 
02165 /*
02166  * Use the lpDDSAlphaDest field in the DDOVERLAYFX structure as the alpha
02167  * channel destination for this overlay.
02168  */
02169 #define DDOVER_ALPHADESTSURFACEOVERRIDE         0x00000008l
02170 
02171 /*
02172  * Use the dwAlphaEdgeBlend field in the DDOVERLAYFX structure as the alpha
02173  * channel for the edges of the image that border the color key colors.
02174  */
02175 #define DDOVER_ALPHAEDGEBLEND                   0x00000010l
02176 
02177 /*
02178  * Use the alpha information in the pixel format or the alpha channel surface
02179  * attached to the source surface as the source alpha channel for this overlay.
02180  */
02181 #define DDOVER_ALPHASRC                         0x00000020l
02182 
02183 /*
02184  * Use the dwConstAlphaSrc field in the DDOVERLAYFX structure as the source
02185  * alpha channel for this overlay.
02186  */
02187 #define DDOVER_ALPHASRCCONSTOVERRIDE            0x00000040l
02188 
02189 /*
02190  * The NEG suffix indicates that the source surface becomes more transparent
02191  * as the alpha value increases.
02192  */
02193 #define DDOVER_ALPHASRCNEG                      0x00000080l
02194 
02195 /*
02196  * Use the lpDDSAlphaSrc field in the DDOVERLAYFX structure as the alpha channel
02197  * source for this overlay.
02198  */
02199 #define DDOVER_ALPHASRCSURFACEOVERRIDE          0x00000100l
02200 
02201 /*
02202  * Turn this overlay off.
02203  */
02204 #define DDOVER_HIDE                             0x00000200l
02205 
02206 /*
02207  * Use the color key associated with the destination surface.
02208  */
02209 #define DDOVER_KEYDEST                          0x00000400l
02210 
02211 /*
02212  * Use the dckDestColorkey field in the DDOVERLAYFX structure as the color key
02213  * for the destination surface
02214  */
02215 #define DDOVER_KEYDESTOVERRIDE                  0x00000800l
02216 
02217 /*
02218  * Use the color key associated with the source surface.
02219  */
02220 #define DDOVER_KEYSRC                           0x00001000l
02221 
02222 /*
02223  * Use the dckSrcColorkey field in the DDOVERLAYFX structure as the color key
02224  * for the source surface.
02225  */
02226 #define DDOVER_KEYSRCOVERRIDE                   0x00002000l
02227 
02228 /*
02229  * Turn this overlay on.
02230  */
02231 #define DDOVER_SHOW                             0x00004000l
02232 
02233 /*
02234  * Add a dirty rect to an emulated overlayed surface.
02235  */
02236 #define DDOVER_ADDDIRTYRECT                     0x00008000l
02237 
02238 /*
02239  * Redraw all dirty rects on an emulated overlayed surface.
02240  */
02241 #define DDOVER_REFRESHDIRTYRECTS                0x00010000l
02242 
02243 /*
02244  * Redraw the entire surface on an emulated overlayed surface.
02245  */
02246 #define DDOVER_REFRESHALL                      0x00020000l
02247 
02248 
02249 /*
02250  * Use the overlay FX flags to define special overlay FX
02251  */
02252 #define DDOVER_DDFX                             0x00080000l
02253 
02254 
02255 /****************************************************************************
02256  *
02257  * DIRECTDRAWSURFACE LOCK FLAGS
02258  *
02259  ****************************************************************************/
02260 
02261 /*
02262  * The default.  Set to indicate that Lock should return a valid memory pointer
02263  * to the top of the specified rectangle.  If no rectangle is specified then a
02264  * pointer to the top of the surface is returned.
02265  */
02266 #define DDLOCK_SURFACEMEMORYPTR                 0x00000000L     // default
02267 
02268 /*
02269  * Set to indicate that Lock should wait until it can obtain a valid memory
02270  * pointer before returning.  If this bit is set, Lock will never return 
02271  * DDERR_WASSTILLDRAWING.
02272  */
02273 #define DDLOCK_WAIT                             0x00000001L
02274 
02275 /*
02276  * Set if an event handle is being passed to Lock.  Lock will trigger the event
02277  * when it can return the surface memory pointer requested.
02278  */
02279 #define DDLOCK_EVENT                            0x00000002L
02280 
02281 /*
02282  * Indicates that the surface being locked will only be read from.
02283  */
02284 #define DDLOCK_READONLY                         0x00000010L
02285 
02286 /*
02287  * Indicates that the surface being locked will only be written to
02288  */
02289 #define DDLOCK_WRITEONLY                        0x00000020L
02290 
02291

02300  */
02301

02314 /****************************************************************************
02315  *
02316  * DIRECTDRAWSURFACE BLT FX FLAGS
02317  *
02318  ****************************************************************************/
02319 
02320 /*
02321  * If stretching, use arithmetic stretching along the Y axis for this blt.
02322  */
02323 #define DDBLTFX_ARITHSTRETCHY                   0x00000001l
02324 
02325 /*
02326  * Do this blt mirroring the surface left to right.  Spin the
02327  * surface around its y-axis.
02328  */
02329 #define DDBLTFX_MIRRORLEFTRIGHT                 0x00000002l
02330 
02331 /*
02332  * Do this blt mirroring the surface up and down.  Spin the surface
02333  * around its x-axis.
02334  */
02335 #define DDBLTFX_MIRRORUPDOWN                    0x00000004l
02336 
02337 /*
02338  * Schedule this blt to avoid tearing.
02339  */
02340 #define DDBLTFX_NOTEARING                       0x00000008l
02341 
02342 /*
02343  * Do this blt rotating the surface one hundred and eighty degrees.
02344  */
02345 #define DDBLTFX_ROTATE180                       0x00000010l
02346 
02347 /*
02348  * Do this blt rotating the surface two hundred and seventy degrees.
02349  */
02350 #define DDBLTFX_ROTATE270                       0x00000020l
02351 
02352 /*
02353  * Do this blt rotating the surface ninety degrees.
02354  */
02355 #define DDBLTFX_ROTATE90                        0x00000040l
02356 
02357 /*
02358  * Do this z blt using dwZBufferLow and dwZBufferHigh as  range values
02359  * specified to limit the bits copied from the source surface.
02360  */
02361 #define DDBLTFX_ZBUFFERRANGE                    0x00000080l
02362 
02363 /*
02364  * Do this z blt adding the dwZBufferBaseDest to each of the sources z values
02365  * before comparing it with the desting z values.
02366  */
02367 #define DDBLTFX_ZBUFFERBASEDEST                 0x00000100l
02368

02496 /*===========================================================================
02497  *
02498  *
02499  * DIRECTDRAW RETURN CODES
02500  *
02501  * The return values from DirectDraw Commands and Surface that return an HRESULT
02502  * are codes from DirectDraw concerning the results of the action
02503  * requested by DirectDraw.
02504  *
02505  *==========================================================================*/
02506 
02507 /*
02508  * Status is OK
02509  *
02510  * Issued by: DirectDraw Commands and all callbacks
02511  */
02512 #define DD_OK                                   0
02513 
02514 /****************************************************************************
02515  *
02516  * DIRECTDRAW ENUMCALLBACK RETURN VALUES
02517  *
02518  * EnumCallback returns are used to control the flow of the DIRECTDRAW and
02519  * DIRECTDRAWSURFACE object enumerations.   They can only be returned by
02520  * enumeration callback routines.
02521  *
02522  ****************************************************************************/
02523 
02524 /*
02525  * stop the enumeration
02526  */
02527 #define DDENUMRET_CANCEL                        0
02528 
02529 /*
02530  * continue the enumeration
02531  */
02532 #define DDENUMRET_OK                            1
02533
